column4: seriosuly how do I expanded the authentication options ubuntu gives me for for wifi
If you want to use wpa, you need to install wpa_supplicant
I'd recommend wicd if you want more control.
what does that mean, I don't care about the control I just want to connect to a WPA network...
I have the wpasupplicant package, did you mean a diffrent one?
Nope. When you try to connect to the network, it *should* prompt you for the key.
it asks me to tell it what kind of key I am giving it, and none of the option are right
Are you sure? What option are you looking for?
any WPA preshared key would be a nice ********'ing sign
when I click the network I want to connect to it asks me what kind of security it is using and there are Three WEP options and LEAP
Are you *positive* you have wpa_supplicant installed? If so, try rebooting.
Well, okay then. I have no idea.
Not really. WPA works fine for me. All I had to install was wpa supplicant.
